author: Samuel J. White and Philippe B. Wilson
title: Air pollution may be linked to eczema
text:
If you live in a city or near a busy road, it might not be just your lungs bearing the brunt of air pollution – your skin could be suffering too. A recent study has found a significant link between high levels of fine particulate matter (PM2.5) and incidence of eczema – a chronic inflammatory skin condition marked by itching, redness and discomfort.
The research, conducted on more than 280,000 people across the US, revealed that people exposed to higher concentrations of PM2.5 were more than twice as likely to have eczema compared with those in less polluted areas.
This study sheds new light on how our external environment may affect our skin health and raises questions about how we can protect ourselves as pollution levels climb.
Particulate matter and skin health
PM2.5 is shorthand for particulate matter that is less than 2.5 micrometres in diameter. These particles are so small that you would need a microscope to see them – yet they have significant health risks.
Emitted from sources such as cars, industrial sites and even wildfire smoke, these tiny particles contain harmful chemicals – including polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons. These chemicals are carcinogenic and have been linked to respiratory, cardiovascular and developmental health issues.
Although we have a good understanding of the significant effect PM2.5 has on the health of our lungs, scientists are only just beginning to uncover all the ways these particles affect the health of our skin.
This latest study provides yet more evidence of the effects that pollution appears to have on our skin health. The study found that participants with eczema had been exposed to slightly higher-than-average PM2.5 levels than those without the condition. This difference was linked to a significantly higher incidence of eczema in those exposed to high levels of air pollution. This was true even after the researchers adjusted their analysis to account for other factors that may have affected a person’s risk of eczema.
While this study can’t directly prove that air pollution caused or worsened eczema in these participants, numerous studies have pinpointed the ways in which air pollution affects the skin. This may help to explain the link the study found.
Research shows that the tiny size of PM2.5 allows it to infiltrate the skin barrier – the body’s first line of defence. This means it can penetrate skin cells directly, reaching deeper layers where it can cause even more damage to cells. This disruption can impair the skin’s natural defences, leading to increased inflammation and skin sensitivity. For people already struggling with eczema, this intrusion is like pouring salt on an open wound.
Other studies may point to reasons why air pollution could trigger or worsen eczema in the first place.
It appears that PM2.5 may interact with our skin’s immune responses in ways we are only beginning to understand. When these particles reach the skin, they bind to a receptor called the aryl hydrocarbon receptor (AhR), a protein known to mediate how cells respond to environmental toxins. This interaction can ignite a cascade of immune responses – essentially triggering an inflammatory response in the skin. For someone prone to eczema, these immune responses can result in the itching, swelling and redness that define the condition.
Previous studies have also found that people with eczema have an impaired skin barrier, making them more susceptible to absorbing external irritants such as pollutants. In addition, research supports the idea that PM2.5 might exacerbate eczema by further compromising the skin barrier.
Health risks
These findings couldn’t come at a more critical time. Globally, air pollution levels are rising – and urban populations are being exposed to ever-higher amounts of PM2.5. According to the World Health Organisation, around 90 per cent of people globally breathe air with unsafe levels of pollutants. Already vulnerable groups – including children, the elderly and those with pre-existing skin conditions – could be most at risk of developing eczema.
It’s becoming increasingly clear that pollution affects health in multifaceted ways, beyond just respiratory issues. Our skin, the body’s largest organ, is also at risk. Recognising these connections could guide policies to enforce stricter air quality controls, protecting not only the air we breathe, but also the skin we rely on for protection.
On a personal level, reducing direct exposure to polluted air can be beneficial – especially for those prone to eczema. Some ways of doing this include staying indoors on high-pollution days, using air purifiers and covering exposed skin.
There’s also promise in treatments targeting the AhR pathway. Current research into treatments that activate “good” pathways of AhR in the skin shows potential for managing eczema symptoms – especially for those exposed to elevated PM2.5 levels. Tapinarof, a cream investigators are currently testing, could potentially counterbalance the harmful effect of pollution on the skin if proven successful. This could provide hope to eczema sufferers.
This emerging understanding on the hidden impacts of air pollution suggests that it could be a hidden culprit in the global rise of skin issues such as eczema.
- Samuel J. White is associate professor and head of projects and Philippe B. Wilson is associate pro vice-chancellor, innovation and knowledge exchange, at York St John University in the UK. This article was first published in
[The Conversation.](https://theconversation.com/air-pollution-linked-to-eczema-new-research-243546)

author: NE NOW NEWS
title: Life Insurance: A Financial Investment to Protect Your Loved Ones
text: Ensuring your family’s financial safety is paramount in today’s world, and a life insurance plan serves as a perfect tool for achieving this goal. It acts as a robust shield, ensuring your family’s financial stability by offering comprehensive support in your untimely demise. Read on to learn how life insurance can be a valuable financial investment to protect your loved ones. What is a Life Insurance Plan? A [life insurance](https://www.acko.com/life-insurance/) plan is a contractual agreement between you and the insurance company. In this agreement, the insurance company promises to pay your family and loved ones a specified sum after your demise. However, you must pay a premium at regular intervals so your family can receive the death benefits for various expenditures. [Ready for a challenge? Click here to take our quiz and show off your knowledge!](#quiz) Why Should You Get Life Insurance for Your Loved Ones? The following are a few reasons why you must invest in a life insurance plan for your family: 1. Financial Security for Your Family One key reason for purchasing a family life insurance plan is that it will protect your family financially in your absence. The death benefit payout is a safety net that will help them stay firm when it seems impossible. They can use the amount to fulfil their financial requirements, such as daily expenditures, debt repayment, emergency needs, etc. 2. Flexible and Customisable Life insurance plans come in different types, such as [term insurance](https://www.acko.com/life-insurance/term-insurance/), unit-linked insurance plans, whole life plans, etc., that you can choose from according to your requirements. In addition, you can choose the policy tenure, sum assured and include riders in your basic insurance plan. These riders allow you to customise the plan according to your specific situation and enable you to receive extra coverage. [Ready for a challenge? Click here to take our quiz and show off your knowledge!](#quiz) 3. Beneficial for Long-Term Goals Investing in a life insurance plan gives financial protection and enables you to achieve long-term financial goals. Many life insurance policies, including whole life insurance plans, offer life coverage and investment components that are useful in fund accumulation over time. You can accumulate these funds to achieve financial goals like a child’s higher education or homeownership. It provides an opportunity to save and plan your long-term financial goals so you can live a financially sound and fulfilling life. 4. Helps Dealing with Financial Liabilities A life insurance plan helps your family to deal with financial liabilities after your sudden demise. Your loved ones can utilise the amount to repay outstanding debts, such as loans, credit card dues, and other financial liabilities. It provides a monetary backup to your loved ones so that they can safeguard your assets. 5. Assist in Income Tax Savings When you pay the premium towards your life insurance plan, you can avail yourself of deductions from taxable income. According to the Income Tax Act 1961, you can get deductions up to ? 1.5 lakhs under Section 80C from your income for such premium paid. In addition, if you include a rider in your life insurance plan, you can get further deductions up to ? 25,000 under Section 80D. How to Apply for a Life Insurance Policy Online? You can follow these simple steps to apply for a life insurance online: Step 1: Visit the official website of your preferred insurance company and create an account by entering your details. Step 2: Provide your information, such as name, contact information, annual income, date of birth, health issue, medical history, etc., and click the ‘Check Price’ option. Step 3: Enter the life insurance amount, premium payment term, and other required details according to your preference and click the ‘Proceed’ button. Step 4: Select the payment method and click the ‘Pay’ option to make payment via your debit card, credit card or UPI. Step 5: After payment, you will receive the life insurance policy in your registered email address. However, please note that this is a generic procedure for buying a life insurance policy in India, and the procedure may differ from insurer to insurer. Final Words A life insurance plan is a responsible and caring financial investment for your family. Choosing the right plan that will create a safety net for them will empower your loved ones to lead life confidently, even when you may not be there to guide them. Make sure to read all the terms and conditions of your insurance policy before buying it to avoid any hassle during times of need.

author: Anukul Chauhan
title: Wanindu Hasaranga magic seals Sri Lanka's T20 Series win over Zimbabwe
text: In a dominant display of spin bowling mastery, Wanindu Hasaranga twirled his way to a stunning 4-15 performance, leading Sri Lanka to a convincing nine-wicket victory over Zimbabwe in the final T20 international and securing a 2-1 series win for the hosts. Zimbabwe’s batsmen fell prey to mesmerizing leg-spin of Wanindu Hasaranga , limping to a record-low total of 82 all out, their innings collapsing with 35 balls still remaining. The tourists’ meager score stood as their lowest ever in T20 internationals, surpassing even their previous mark of 84 against New Zealand in 2010. With an impossibly low target to chase, Sri Lanka wasted no time. Opening batsman Pathum Nissanka blasted to an unbeaten 39 off just 23 deliveries, smashing five boundaries and a six to seal the win with a thunderous six off the 11th over. Kusal Mendis’ 33 was the only other significant contribution with the bat for Sri Lanka. Also Read T20 World Cup 2024 Full schedule T20 World Cup: Yuvraj Singh picks favourite youngsters in Team India for T20 WC Rohit Sharma or Hardik Pandya? Axar Patel reveals his choice for India T20 captain Why picking Yashasvi Jaiswal over Gill was the right decision by Rohit & Dravid Hardik Pandya calls the shots: BCCI involves all-rounder in T20 World Cup planning Wanindu Hasaranga lead Sri Lanka to series win The victory capped off a dominant series performance for Sri Lanka, erasing the sting of their last-over thriller defeat in the second match. Angelo Mathews provided early support with the ball, grabbing two wickets, and Maheesh Theekshana also chipped in with one scalp. Zimbabwe’s only bright spot came in the opening overs, with Brian Bennett (29) and Tinashe Kamunhukamwe (12) briefly threatening to build a partnership. However, Wanindu Hasaranga masterful spell shut down any hopes of a fightback, showcasing his growing stature as a world-class spinner. Sri Lanka’s series win marks a welcome return to form after a turbulent period. Captain Wanindu Hasaranga, who led from the front both with bat and ball, will be delighted with the team’s response and the confidence boost this victory brings. For Zimbabwe, despite their late resurgence in the second match , the series serves as a reminder of the work required to consistently compete at the international level.

author: Matt Trapani
title: Stormy weather causes damage, power outages across New Jersey - NewsBreak
text:
News 12
website
New Jersey
Stormy weather causes damage, power outages across New Jersey
By Matt Trapani,
5 hours agoStormy weather tore through New Jersey on Wednesday afternoon and evening. The heavy rain caused flooding, storm damage and power outages. A tree fell onto a house on Highland Avenue in Hillside. No injuries were reported. Officials say strong winds caused a brush fire in Jackson Township off Bennets Mills...

author: Redacción LA FM
title: Cúcuta: Funcionarios de UNP protestan por despidos masivos
text: [Elibardo León Estévez ](/autores/elibardo-leon-estevez) Manifestaciones en Cúcuta: Funcionarios de la UNP protestan por despidos masivos El sindicato de la UNP aseguraron que al personal de esquemas de seguridad le notificaron a través de correos electrónicos la cancelación de sus contratos. En las instalaciones de la Unidad Nacional de Protección en la ciudad de Cúcuta miembros de esta institución realizan una protesta por el despido injustificado de por lo menos 80 trabajadores, a los cuales les fueron suspendidos sus contratos sin previo aviso. Le puede interesar: [Ordenan que exsubdirector de la UNP permanezca en prisión por caso del 'narcochofer'](https://www.lafm.com.co/judicial/ordenan-que-exsubdirector-de-la-unp-permanezca-en-prision-por-caso-del-narcochofer) La denuncia la realizó el sindicato de la UNP en la ciudad, quienes aseguraron que a este personal de esquemas de seguridad le notificaron a través de correos electrónicos la cancelación de sus contratos, sin ninguna justificación. Este hecho llevó a que los funcionarios despedidos y los miembros del sindicato tomaran vías de hecho, exigiendo una respuesta a la Unidad Nacional de Protección del por qué se tomó esta decisión de suspender los contratos dejando sin trabajo a este número de trabajadores. David Gerardino Pertúz presidente del Sindicato de la UNP UNSITRASEG en la ciudad de Cúcuta, en diálogos con La FM, indicó que los trabajadores despedidos arriesgan sus vidas por sus protegidos y hoy se quedan sin ningún tipo de vínculo laboral. “En el transcurso del miércoles y el jueves de esta semana fueron notificados de sus despidos, es una situación que nos parece injusta, pues simplemente les dijeron que no se contaría más con sus servicios y por ello brindamos el apoyo realizando esta movilización pacífica”; expreso el presidente del sindicato de la UNP en Cúcuta. El líder sindical aseguró que cada vez que las uniones temporales quienes tercerizan los contratos con la UNP finalizan los mismos, se presentan este tipo de situaciones, dejando sin empleo a decenas de trabajadores en todo el país. De igual forma, los miembros de esta institución solicitan a la misma una respuesta y solución a lo que consideran una masacre laboral, que afecta un número importante de hogares en la ciudad de Cúcuta. Le puede interesar: [Balacera en el sur de Bogotá deja un miembro de la UNP muerto y un herido](https://www.lafm.com.co/bogota/balacera-en-el-sur-de-bogota-deja-un-miembro-de-la-unp-muerto-y-otro-herido) Han indicado que se mantendrán en las instalaciones de la UNP protestando de manera masiva para que se reconozca los derechos laborales de estas personas, quienes denuncian despidos injustificados.

author: matt
title: Cedar Fair (NYSE:FUN) Research Coverage Started at StockNews.com
text:
StockNews.com started coverage on shares of Cedar Fair ( NYSE:FUN – Free Report) in a research report released on Tuesday. The firm issued a buy rating on the stock.
FUN has been the topic of a number of other research reports. Truist Financial raised their target price on Cedar Fair from $44.00 to $46.00 and gave the company a buy rating in a report on Tuesday, January 9th. Citigroup upgraded Cedar Fair from a neutral rating to a buy rating and increased their target price for the stock from $40.00 to $46.00 in a research report on Friday, November 3rd. Stifel Nicolaus cut their price objective on shares of Cedar Fair from $51.00 to $49.00 and set a buy rating for the company in a research report on Wednesday, November 22nd. Morgan Stanley boosted their target price on Cedar Fair from $50.00 to $55.00 and gave the stock an overweight rating in a research report on Thursday, December 14th. Finally, B. Riley decreased their price objective on shares of Cedar Fair from $58.00 to $56.00 and set a buy rating on the stock in a research report on Wednesday, October 18th. Two research analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and nine have issued a buy rating to the company. According to data from MarketBeat, Cedar Fair has a consensus rating of Moderate Buy and an average target price of $49.64.
Read Our Latest Stock Analysis on Cedar Fair
Cedar Fair Price Performance
FUNopened at $39.28 on Tuesday. Cedar Fair has a one year low of $34.04 and a one year high of $47.95. The stock has a 50-day moving average of $38.79 and a 200-day moving average of $38.39. The company has a market cap of $2.00 billion, a PE ratio of 13.50 and a beta of 1.44.
Cedar Fair (
NYSE:FUN – Get Free Report) last issued its earnings results on Thursday, November 2nd. The company reported $4.21 earnings per share for the quarter, topping analysts’ consensus estimates of $3.70 by $0.51. Cedar Fair had a negative return on equity of 22.33% and a net margin of 8.19%. The company had revenue of $842.01 million for the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $821.16 million. Analysts expect that Cedar Fair will post 2.86 EPS for the current fiscal year.
Cedar Fair Announces Dividend
The firm also recently declared a quarterly dividend, which was paid on Wednesday, December 20th. Shareholders of record on Wednesday, December 6th were given a dividend of $0.30 per share. The ex-dividend date was Tuesday, December 5th. This represents a $1.20 annualized dividend and a yield of 3.05%. Cedar Fair’s payout ratio is 41.24%.
Institutional Investors Weigh In On Cedar Fair
A number of hedge funds and other institutional investors have recently modified their holdings of the stock. PenderFund Capital Management Ltd. bought a new stake in Cedar Fair during the 1st quarter valued at $41,000. Money Concepts Capital Corp bought a new position in shares of Cedar Fair during the fourth quarter valued at about $26,000. Tower Research Capital LLC TRC grew its stake in shares of Cedar Fair by 355.3% in the first quarter. Tower Research Capital LLC TRC now owns 815 shares of the company’s stock worth $38,000 after purchasing an additional 636 shares during the last quarter. CENTRAL TRUST Co bought a new stake in shares of Cedar Fair in the second quarter worth about $46,000. Finally, Ancora Advisors LLC increased its holdings in Cedar Fair by 34.6% during the 1st quarter. Ancora Advisors LLC now owns 2,139 shares of the company’s stock valued at $106,000 after purchasing an additional 550 shares during the period. Institutional investors own 61.81% of the company’s stock.
About Cedar Fair
Cedar Fair, L.P. owns and operates amusement and water parks, and complementary resort facilities in the United States and Canada. Its amusement parks include Cedar Point located on Lake Erie between Cleveland and Toledo in Sandusky, Ohio; Knott's Berry Farm near Los Angeles, California; Canada's Wonderland near Toronto, Ontario; Kings Island near Cincinnati, Ohio; Carowinds in Charlotte, North Carolina; Kings Dominion situated near Richmond, Virginia; California's Great America located in Santa Clara, California; Dorney Park in Pennsylvania; Worlds of Fun located in Kansas City, Missouri; Valleyfair situated near Minneapolis/St.
